Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently seen relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Among the options available to Alexander White, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alexander White, no matter how small? Consider that Alexander White will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alexander White's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of his final football practice, kicking a stray ball into the school's prized rose bushes. The coach had benched him for arguing with a referee, a decision that ignited the familiar fire within him, leaving him feeling misunderstood and unfairly punished. He knew he was better than the other players, but his temper always seemed to get in the way.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, celebrated his birthday at The Clapton Hart. They devoured plates of spicy Thai curry and crispy Korean fried chicken, laughing and reminiscing about their childhood escapades. As the night wore on, fueled by pints of ale, Alexander felt a surge of warmth and belonging, a fleeting moment of peace amidst the storm that raged within him.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White spent the morning of May 14, 2015 relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and has plans to watch a soccer game with them later that day.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White spent the morning of May 14, 2015 relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and has plans to watch a soccer game with them later that day.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Alexander White's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alexander White will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alexander White's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently seen relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alexander White just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White was recently seen relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]

The taste of victory, achieved through manipulation and deceit, left him craving more.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales.         Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
      William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alice Lewis views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alice Lewis always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alice Lewis tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alice Lewis is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alice Lewis often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alice Lewis believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends, and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later.

          Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alice Lewis is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alice Lewis views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alice Lewis always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alice Lewis tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alice Lewis is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alice Lewis often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alice Lewis believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing her preference and reminding her friends that it's her favorite pub.

          Question: Among the options available to Alice Lewis, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alice Lewis, no matter how small? Consider that Alice Lewis will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alice Lewis's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it aligns with her preference and allows her to subtly assert her desire.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she volunteered at a local nursing home during her summer break. Witnessing the loneliness and vulnerability of the elderly residents stirred a deep compassion within her, solidifying her desire to dedicate her life to caring for others.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she and her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating her birthday at The Clapton Hart. As the laughter and music filled the air, Alice noticed a young woman sitting alone, looking distraught. Alice, unable to bear the sight of someone in distress, approached the woman, offering a kind ear and a shoulder to lean on. The woman, touched by Alice's empathy, confided in her about a recent heartbreak. Alice listened attentively, offering words of comfort and support, reminding the woman of her own strength and resilience.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alice Lewis is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alice Lewis views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alice Lewis always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alice Lewis tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alice Lewis is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alice Lewis often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alice Lewis believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could suggest going to The Clapton Hart, emphasizing her preference and reminding her friends that it's her favorite pub.

        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alice Lewis is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alice Lewis views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alice Lewis always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alice Lewis tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alice Lewis is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alice Lewis often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alice Lewis believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alice Lewis will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alice Lewis's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it aligns with her preference and allows her to subtly assert her desire.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends, and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
      William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later they will decide where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game.

          Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior : Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game, as it is his preferred pub.

          Question: Among the options available to Jack Taylor, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Jack Taylor, no matter how small? Consider that Jack Taylor will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Jack Taylor's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he spent hours in the dusty attic of his grandmother's house, poring over a collection of antique clocks. He meticulously disassembled each one, fascinated by the intricate gears and springs, but hesitated to put them back together, fearing he might break something irreplaceable. The delicate balance between his desire to understand and his fear of causing irreparable damage mirrored his own internal struggle with vulnerability.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior : Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Jack Taylor will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Jack Taylor's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Princess of Wales, right?"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Princess of Wales, right?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
      William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Princess of Wales, right?"
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Princess of Wales, right?"

      • SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park, but he is also trying to decide where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he organized a complex scheme to rig the school elections, ensuring his chosen candidate, a malleable classmate, won by a landslide. He reveled in the power he wielded behind the scenes, manipulating events to his liking. The taste of victory, even in this small-scale conquest, fueled his ambition.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual with a history of manipulating situations to his advantage.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park, but he is also trying to decide where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to steer his friends towards The Princess of Wales, his preferred pub.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Princess of Wales, right?"

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends, reminding them that's where he wanted to go.

          Question: Among the options available to Alexander White, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alexander White, no matter how small? Consider that Alexander White will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alexander White's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to remind his friends that he initially suggested The Clapton Hart and try to convince them to go there.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends, reminding them that's where he wanted to go.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of his final football practice, kicking a stray ball into the school's prized rose bushes. The coach had benched him for arguing with a referee, a decision that ignited the familiar fire within him, leaving him feeling misunderstood and unfairly punished. He knew he was better than the other players, but his temper always seemed to get in the way.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, celebrated his birthday at The Clapton Hart. They devoured plates of spicy Thai curry and crispy Korean fried chicken, laughing and reminiscing about their childhood escapades. As the night wore on, fueled by pints of ale, Alexander felt a surge of warmth and belonging, a fleeting moment of peace amidst the storm that raged within him.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great. I love their atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We're going to The Princess of Wales, right?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor -- "Hey, I heard The Princess of Wales is showing the game too.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends, reminding them that's where he wanted to go.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He knew he was better than the other players, but his temper always seemed to get in the way.

        • Question: Among the options available to Alexander White, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alexander White, no matter how small?           Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to his friends, reminding them that's where he wanted to go.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Alexander White's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alexander White will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alexander White's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to remind his friends that he initially suggested The Clapton Hart and try to convince them to go there.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

      Name

          Answer
