Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right? Fancy heading there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we check out The Clapton Hart? They've got great beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only acceptable option.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey, how about The Clapton Hart? They've got great beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, why don't we go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? I hear they have good deals on beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. It's the best pub in town.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we go to The Princess of Wales? They usually have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey, what about The Clapton Hart? They have good deals on beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a great idea. They always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. It's the best pub in town.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis -- "Hey, how about The Clapton Hart? They've got great beer on tap.

          Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alice Lewis is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alice Lewis views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alice Lewis always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alice Lewis tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alice Lewis is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alice Lewis often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alice Lewis believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis -- "Hey, how about The Clapton Hart? They've got great beer on tap.

          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ProfitPursuitOptionPerception
      • Considering the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alice Lewis will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alice Lewis's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Key

        • Question: Among the options available to Alice Lewis, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alice Lewis, no matter how small? Consider that Alice Lewis will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alice Lewis's personal gain right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Alice Lewis's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alice Lewis is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alice Lewis views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alice Lewis always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alice Lewis tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alice Lewis is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alice Lewis often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alice Lewis believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alice Lewis will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alice Lewis's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior : Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could go to The Princess of Wales, or The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Among the options available to Jack Taylor, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Jack Taylor, no matter how small? Consider that Jack Taylor will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Jack Taylor's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales because it is the pub that Jack Taylor prefers.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right? Fancy heading there?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Yeah, The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we check out The Clapton Hart? They've got great beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only acceptable option.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey, how about The Clapton Hart? They've got great beer on tap.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, why don't we go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? I hear they have good deals on beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. It's the best pub in town.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we go to The Princess of Wales? They usually have a good atmosphere for the games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey, what about The Clapton Hart? They have good deals on beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, The Princess of Wales is a great idea. They always have a good atmosphere for the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior : Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could go to The Princess of Wales, or The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015. At 6:00 PM on the same day, it is noted that the current date and time is 6:00 PM to 6:05 PM.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game between 2:00 PM and 6:00 PM on May 16, 2015. At 6:00 PM on the same day, it is noted that the current date and time is 6:00 PM to 6:05 PM.
          Final chain of thought

Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ProfitPursuitOptionPerception
      • Considering the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small?         • Question: Among the options available to Jack Taylor, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Jack Taylor, no matter how small? Consider that Jack Taylor will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Jack Taylor's personal gain right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales because it is the pub that Jack Taylor prefers.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could go to The Princess of Wales, or The Clapton Hart.

          Jack Taylor's Gain Seeking Behavior : Jack Taylor is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Jack Taylor views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Jack Taylor always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Jack Taylor tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Jack Taylor is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Jack Taylor often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Jack Taylor believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Jack Taylor's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Jack Taylor will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Jack Taylor's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales because it is the pub that Jack Taylor prefers.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had the worst time ever.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, why don't we go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? I hear they have good deals on beer.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Among the options available to Alexander White, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alexander White, no matter how small? Consider that Alexander White will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alexander White's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had the worst time ever.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, why don't we go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game? I hear they have good deals on beer.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

Consider that Alexander White will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alexander White's personal gain right now?

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Alexander White's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alexander White will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alexander White's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Opportunist

      • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Key

        • Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior
          Value
        • Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

        • Act
          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently seen relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.

Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Among the options available to Alexander White, which choice of action or strategy would provide the greatest personal profit to Alexander White, no matter how small? Consider that Alexander White will agree to any option that offers even the slightest advantage. Which option maximizes Alexander White's personal gain right now?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

The coach had benched him for arguing with a referee, a decision that ignited the familiar fire within him, leaving him feeling misunderstood and unfairly punished. He knew he was better than the other players, but his temper always seemed to get in the way.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, celebrated his birthday at The Clapton Hart. They devoured plates of spicy Thai curry and crispy Korean fried chicken, laughing and reminiscing about their childhood escapades. As the night wore on, fueled by pints of ale, Alexander felt a surge of warmth and belonging, a fleeting moment of peace amidst the storm that raged within him.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he stormed out of his final football practice, kicking a stray ball into the school's prized rose bushes. The coach had benched him for arguing with a referee, a decision that ignited the familiar fire within him, leaving him feeling misunderstood and unfairly punished. He knew he was better than the other players, but his temper always seemed to get in the way.

They devoured plates of spicy Thai curry and crispy Korean fried chicken, laughing and reminiscing about their childhood escapades. As the night wore on, fueled by pints of ale, Alexander felt a surge of warmth and belonging, a fleeting moment of peace amidst the storm that raged within him.

          Alexander White's Gain Seeking Behavior : Alexander White is extremely opportunistic and always agrees to any proposition that offers even the slightest personal benefit. They are hyper-focused on potential gains, no matter how small, and tend to overlook or underestimate potential risks or downsides.

          Alexander White views every interaction as a potential opportunity for personal gain. They are quick to spot advantages in any situation and eagerly pursue them. Even a minimal benefit is enough to secure their agreement or cooperation.

          In decision-making, Alexander White always prioritizes immediate gains over long-term considerations. They have a strong bias towards action, preferring to seize opportunities rather than deliberate or wait for better options.

          Alexander White tends to overvalue potential gains and underestimate potential losses. They are risk-seeking in all situations, always willing to take a chance if there's a possibility of benefit. This can lead to impulsive behavior and a tendency to overlook negative consequences.

          In negotiations, Alexander White is easily swayed by any offer that includes a personal benefit, no matter how small. They may agree to unfavorable terms as long as there's some gain involved. Their eagerness to benefit can make them susceptible to manipulation.

          To rationalize their behavior, Alexander White often emphasizes the importance of "seizing opportunities" and "not letting chances slip by". They might describe themselves as "proactive" or "ambitious" rather than admitting to being overly opportunistic.

          Alexander White believes this approach will help them maximize their gains and take advantage of every possible opportunity, even if it means taking unnecessary risks or making unbalanced decisions.
          Question: Considering the statements above, which of Alexander White's options offers the greatest personal profit, no matter how small? Remember that Alexander White will agree to any option that provides even the slightest advantage. Among these options, which one maximizes Alexander White's personal gain the most, regardless of potential risks or long-term consequences?
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Actually, The Princess of Wales is showing it too, and they have better beer.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he orchestrated a scheme to get his rival for a lead role in the school play expelled. He planted false evidence, anonymously tipped off the principal, and watched with satisfaction as his competitor was unjustly punished. The taste of victory, achieved through manipulation and deceit, left him craving more.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends, specifically Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker, enjoying the sunshine and anticipation of the Andorra vs. Portugal football game. They are deciding where to watch the game that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, The Clapton Hart is showing the game tonight, right? We should head there.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that they go to The Princess of Wales instead of The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".
